clusters.title: Trump passed over for Nobel Peace Prize
clusters.neutral_headline: Nobel Peace Prize Awarded to Venezuelan Opposition Leader

items.title: Trump passed over for Nobel Peace Prize
items.standfirst: President Trump has publicly campaigned for the Nobel Peace Prize, but was passed over this year. Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado received the prize for her work "promoting democratic rights for the people of Venezuela." Political strategists Meghan Hays and Rina Shah join "The Takeout" to discuss.
items.content: President Trump has publicly campaigned for the Nobel Peace Prize, but was passed over this year. Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado received the prize for her work "promoting democratic rights for the people of Venezuela." Political strategists Meghan Hays and Rina Shah join "The Takeout" to discuss.

items.title: Who is Nobel Peace Prize winner Maria Corina Machado?
items.standfirst: Former Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado, who's in hiding, is the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize winner.
items.content: Former Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado, who's in hiding, is the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize winner.

items.title: For Trump world, the focus shifts to next year's Nobel Peace Prize
items.standfirst: The push to make President Donald Trump the winner of the 2026 Nobel Peace Prize began within hours of Venezuela's Maria Corina Machado winning.
items.content: The push to make President Donald Trump the winner of the 2026 Nobel Peace Prize began within hours of Venezuela's Maria Corina Machado winning.

items.title: As Nobel Prize goes to Venezuela's opposition leader, how far would Trump go to help her?
items.standfirst: Maria Corina Machado called on Donald Trump directly to help her country which continues to be at crisis.
items.content: Maria Corina Machado called on Donald Trump directly to help her country which continues to be at crisis.

items.title: Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado wins Nobel Peace Prize
items.standfirst: Machado is recognised for "tireless work promoting democratic rights" in Venezuela, the Nobel Committee says.
items.content: Machado is recognised for "tireless work promoting democratic rights" in Venezuela, the Nobel Committee says.

items.title: Nobel peace prize officials investigate surge in bets for winner
items.standfirst: Bets for Maria Corina Machado spiked on Polymarket gambling site hours before she was awarded prizeNorwegian officials who oversee the Nobel peace prize are investigating suspicious online betting for this year’s winner that suggests a rare leak from the secretive committee that hands out the prize.Online bets for the Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado spiked on the Polymarket gambling site shortly after midnight on Thursday, Norwegian time, according to the information on its website. Continue reading...
items.content: Bets for Maria Corina Machado spiked on Polymarket gambling site hours before she was awarded prizeNorwegian officials who oversee the Nobel peace prize are investigating suspicious online betting for this year’s winner that suggests a rare leak from the secretive committee that hands out the prize.Online bets for the Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado spiked on the Polymarket gambling site shortly after midnight on Thursday, Norwegian time, according to the information on its website. Continue reading...

items.title: Maria Corina Machado’s Nobel win: Insights from the Norwegian Nobel Committee
items.standfirst: Jorgen Watne Frydnes, Chair of the Norwegian Nobel Committee, joined FRANCE 24 shortly after announcing the Nobel Peace Prize winner, Maria Corina Machado. Frydnes discussed Machado’s tireless efforts as a leader of the democratic movement in Venezuela and explained the Committee’s selection process. This year’s choice highlights, according to him, a brave and courageous individual who embodies the core values of the prize.
items.content: Jorgen Watne Frydnes, Chair of the Norwegian Nobel Committee, joined FRANCE 24 shortly after announcing the Nobel Peace Prize winner, Maria Corina Machado. Frydnes discussed Machado’s tireless efforts as a leader of the democratic movement in Venezuela and explained the Committee’s selection process. This year’s choice highlights, according to him, a brave and courageous individual who embodies the core values of the prize.

items.title: Venezuelan politician María Corina Machado wins Nobel peace prize
items.standfirst: Opponent of Maduro regime receives award and praise for keeping ‘flame of democracy burning’The Venezuelan opposition politician María Corina Machado has won the Nobel peace prize for her dogged struggle to rescue the South American country from its fate as “a brutal, authoritarian state”.Machado, 58, a conservative often described as Venezuela’s Iron Lady, has spent the last year living in hiding after her political movement was widely believed to have beaten the country’s president, Nicolás Maduro, in the July 2024 presidential election. Continue reading...
items.content: Opponent of Maduro regime receives award and praise for keeping ‘flame of democracy burning’The Venezuelan opposition politician María Corina Machado has won the Nobel peace prize for her dogged struggle to rescue the South American country from its fate as “a brutal, authoritarian state”.Machado, 58, a conservative often described as Venezuela’s Iron Lady, has spent the last year living in hiding after her political movement was widely believed to have beaten the country’s president, Nicolás Maduro, in the July 2024 presidential election. Continue reading...

items.title: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado awarded the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize
items.standfirst: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado, who lives in hiding, won the Nobel Peace Prize on October 10 for fighting dictatorship in her country.
items.content: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado, who lives in hiding, won the Nobel Peace Prize on October 10 for fighting dictatorship in her country.

items.title: Venezuela's opposition leader María Corina Machado wins 2025 Nobel Peace Prize
items.standfirst: Venezuela's opposition leader María Corina Machado has won this year's Nobel Peace Prize for her tireless work promoting democratic rights for the people of Venezuela.
items.content: Venezuela's opposition leader María Corina Machado has won this year's Nobel Peace Prize for her tireless work promoting democratic rights for the people of Venezuela.(Image credit: Lexi Parra for NPR)

items.title: Nobel Peace Prize awarded to Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado
items.standfirst: The Nobel Peace Prize was awarded Friday to Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado, who lives in hiding after attempting to run for the presidency last year against President Nicolás Maduro
items.content: The Nobel Peace Prize was awarded Friday to Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado, who lives in hiding after attempting to run for the presidency last year against President Nicolás Maduro

items.content: Venezuelan opposition leader and pro-democracy campaigner Maria Corina Machado has won the Nobel Peace Prize.

ai_summary: Maria Corina Machado won the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize for promoting democratic rights in Venezuela.
Bets on Machado spiked on a gambling site hours before the prize announcement.
Norwegian officials are investigating potential leaks from the Nobel Committee.
Donald Trump was publicly campaigning for the Nobel Peace Prize but was passed over.
Political strategists discussed the implications of the award on "The Takeout".

items.title: Macron reappoints Lecornu as French PM after days of turmoil
items.standfirst: Sébastien Lecornu resigned on Monday after 26 days in the job and he said two days later his "mission is over".
items.content: Sébastien Lecornu resigned on Monday after 26 days in the job and he said two days later his "mission is over".

items.title: Macron reappoints Sébastien Lecornu as French prime minister
items.standfirst: Lecornu, who resigned as PM on Monday, is tasked with urgently delivering a budget to parliamentThe French president, Emmanuel Macron, has reappointed his centrist ally Sébastien Lecornu as prime minister – days after Lecornu dramatically resigned and his new government collapsed after only 14 hours.Lecornu said he accepted returning to the role “out of duty” and would do “everything possible to provide France with a budget by the end of the year and to address the daily life issues of our fellow citizens”. Continue reading...
items.content: Lecornu, who resigned as PM on Monday, is tasked with urgently delivering a budget to parliamentThe French president, Emmanuel Macron, has reappointed his centrist ally Sébastien Lecornu as prime minister – days after Lecornu dramatically resigned and his new government collapsed after only 14 hours.Lecornu said he accepted returning to the role “out of duty” and would do “everything possible to provide France with a budget by the end of the year and to address the daily life issues of our fellow citizens”. Continue reading...

items.title: Macron puts Lecornu back as France's prime minister just days after he quit

items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron has reappointed Sébastien Lecornu as prime minister, just days after his resignation, asking him to try again to form a government and produce a budget.(Image credit: Michel Euler)

items.title: 'I accept out of duty': Macron asks outgoing PM Lecornu to try again to form government
items.standfirst: Just four days after resigning from the role, Sébastien Lecornu was reappointed as prime minister on Friday by French President Emmanuel Macron. The outgoing and now incoming premier will have to try and find, once again, a way out of France's worst political crisis in decades.
items.content: Just four days after resigning from the role, Sébastien Lecornu was reappointed as prime minister on Friday by French President Emmanuel Macron. The outgoing and now incoming premier will have to try and find, once again, a way out of France's worst political crisis in decades.

items.title: Macron Renames Sebastien Lecornu as France’s New Prime Minister
Macron reappoints Lecornu as prime minister - four days after he quit
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron has reappointed Sebastien Lecornu as prime minister.
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron has reappointed Sebastien Lecornu as prime minister.

items.title: Macron reappoints outgoing premier Sébastien Lecornu as French prime minister
France: New PM expected soon, left parties voice disappointment
items.standfirst: The meeting between President Macron and France’s main political parties ended Friday with no clear breakthrough. Left-wing parties expressed disappointment over the process and lack of progress. A new prime minister is expected to be appointed within the next few hours. FRANCE 24's journalists Ellen Gainsford and Rochelle Ferguson have the analysis.
items.content: The meeting between President Macron and France’s main political parties ended Friday with no clear breakthrough. Left-wing parties expressed disappointment over the process and lack of progress. A new prime minister is expected to be appointed within the next few hours. FRANCE 24's journalists Ellen Gainsford and Rochelle Ferguson have the analysis.

items.title: Could a technocratic government end France’s political crisis?
items.standfirst: France’s political crisis deepens after Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu’s resignation, with President Macron meeting parties at the Élysée Palace to avoid snap elections and find a new prime minister. The left appears more united than the divided right, fueling talks of a technocratic government as a possible way out, as FRANCE 24's Rochelle Ferguson analyses.
items.content: France’s political crisis deepens after Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu’s resignation, with President Macron meeting parties at the Élysée Palace to avoid snap elections and find a new prime minister. The left appears more united than the divided right, fueling talks of a technocratic government as a possible way out, as FRANCE 24's Rochelle Ferguson analyses.

items.title: Last-ditch talks underway to appoint French Prime minister and resolve crisis
items.standfirst: Following Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu’s resignation, President Emmanuel Macron has brought together political parties at the Élysée Palace in a final effort to avoid snap elections and find a new prime minister. As our journalist Ellen Gainsford reports, the left wing appears more united than the right amid ongoing talks to resolve France’s political crisis.
items.content: Following Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu’s resignation, President Emmanuel Macron has brought together political parties at the Élysée Palace in a final effort to avoid snap elections and find a new prime minister. As our journalist Ellen Gainsford reports, the left wing appears more united than the right amid ongoing talks to resolve France’s political crisis.

items.title: Macron summons parties for crunch meeting in frantic effort to appoint PM
items.standfirst: All parties except National Rally and La France Insoumise called on by president to show ‘collective responsibility’Emmanuel Macron has summoned the leaders of several political parties to his office to demand they show “collective responsibility” as he attempts to appoint a new prime minister amid a deepening political crisis.All political parties except Marine Le Pen’s far-right National Rally, which is the biggest single opposition party, and Jean-Luc Mélenchon’s leftwing La France Insoumise were called to the meeting at the presidential palace before Macron’s self-imposed deadline to name a new prime minister by Friday night. Continue reading...
items.content: All parties except National Rally and La France Insoumise called on by president to show ‘collective responsibility’Emmanuel Macron has summoned the leaders of several political parties to his office to demand they show “collective responsibility” as he attempts to appoint a new prime minister amid a deepening political crisis.All political parties except Marine Le Pen’s far-right National Rally, which is the biggest single opposition party, and Jean-Luc Mélenchon’s leftwing La France Insoumise were called to the meeting at the presidential palace before Macron’s self-imposed deadline to name a new prime minister by Friday night. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Macron reappointed Lecornu as Prime Minister after his recent resignation.
Lecornu resigned after only 26 days in the role.
Lecornu is tasked with delivering a budget to parliament.
Lecornu accepted the role "out of duty".
The outgoing premier will try to form a government again.

items.standfirst: Israel declared a ceasefire and started pulling back troops in Gaza on Friday, as thousands of displaced Palestinians began to make their way back to their wrecked homes. "Today is a historic day," Shrouq Al-Aila, an independent journalist in Deir al-Balah, told FRANCE 24. "But all of us are carrying heavy hearts. The killing has stopped, but there is another war that began today - that of navigating life in the aftermath."

items.title: Magnitude 7.8 earthquake hits off tip of South America, tsunami threat issued
Seven people killed after twin earthquakes off coast of Philippines
items.standfirst: Quakes of 7.4 and 6.8 magnitude trigger tsunami alerts as people living near coast advised to evacuateTwo powerful offshore earthquakes struck off the coast of the southern Philippines on Friday, killing at least seven people, while towns near the epicentre faced structural damage and authorities warned of strong aftershocks.The first quake of magnitude 7.4, in waters off the town of Manay in the province of Davao Oriental, triggered a tsunami alert for coasts within 186 miles (300km) of the epicentre, but the warnings for the Philippines and Indonesia were subsequently lifted. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Discord says hackers stole government IDs of 70,000 users
clusters.neutral_headline: Discord says hackers stole government IDs of 70,000 users:

items.title: Discord says hackers stole government IDs of 70,000 users
items.standfirst: As more sites require IDs for user age verification, expect more such breaches to come.
items.content: Discord says that hackers made off with images of 70,000 users’ government IDs that they were required to provide in order to use the site. Like an increasing number of sites, Discord requires certain users to provide a photo or scan of their driver's license or other government ID that shows they meet the minimum age requirements in their country. In some cases, Discord allows users to prove their age by providing a selfie that shows their faces (it’s not clear how a face proves someone’s age, but there you go). The social media site imposes these requirements on users who are reported by other users to be under the minimum age for the country they’re connecting from. “A substantial risk for identity theft” On Wednesday, Discord said that ID images of roughly 70,000 users “may have had government-ID photos exposed” in a recent breach of a third-party service Discord entrusted to manage the data. The affected users had communicated with Discord’s Customer Support or Trust & Safety teams and subsequently submitted the IDs in reviews of age-related appeals.Read full article Comments

items.title: ID photos of 70,000 users may have been leaked, Discord says

items.content: The platform says hackers targeted a firm that helped to verify the ages of its users.

ai_summary: Discord reported hackers stole government IDs of 70,000 users.

The platform is increasing its age verification requirements.
